Posts.Content: mrstibbz wrote: About 10 months ago, I had severe pain in my left breast.  It was hot to the touch and hurt if I pressed on it.  That night I had a bloody discharge expel from the nipple.  A few weeks later it happened again.  In between the discharge I would feel achy in that breast, almost like I was having "let down" from breastfeeding (not lactating at the time).  I saw my OB who sent me to an ultrasound and mammogram.  Both were normal w/ dense breast tissue and my Dr. wasn't satisfied that he could see everything.  I was sent to a Breast Surgeon who performed a ductogram.  During all of these tests the discharge was still occurring at 3-4 week intervals, as well as the pain and dull ache.  The ductogram found that there was "something" in a milk duct but again was inconclusive.  I have no lumps or any other symptoms.  I found out I was pregnant 4 months ago and since I have been pregnant I still have the pain, sometimes a sharp shooting pain, however no discharge or blood.  I was supposed to have a breast MRI right around the time I became pregnant but now I am unable to do so until after I have my baby.  I see the breast surgeon for check-ups every three months so they can keep an eye on me.  They wanted to do surgery to remove the duct, however since the discharge doesn't always come out, they are unable to locate the correct duct.  This is extremely frustrating to me since I don't know what is going on inside my body.  My pregnancy is a blessing to my husband and I, however it did throw a bit of a wrench in finding out what is wrong with me.  Anyone had anything similar?  Any suggestions would be great.  I know I will not have an answer from a Dr. any time soon but my mind goes crazy with worry and wonder.  Thanks. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Worrying and Wondering... mrstibbz mrstibbz

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2012 07:37AM mrstibbz wrote: Thank you for your story...I guess I will just have to wait it out and see what the Doc wants to do.  I have a feeling that it will eventually come down to having surgery to remove a duct...or two.  It is nice to have this site for support because I feel so alone sometimes in my worry.  I appreciate your response and wish you the best of luck with whatever you end up having done with your other breast...I hope for your sake its not another surgery!
Posts.Title: Worrying and Wondering... mrstibbz mrstibbz
